    • Method Detail

      • getSingleMappedSamRecords

        public void getSingleMappedSamRecords(java.io.File bamFile,
                             java.io.File fastqIn,
                             java.io.File fastqOut,
                             boolean isRightHandedReads)
        Returns the fastq sequences that have been mapped to a genome. All fastq reads must either be left-handed or right-handed
        Parameters:
        bamFile - a sam/bam file
        fastqIn - the fastq dataset that was mapped to the sam/bam file
        fastqOut - the fastq reads that were actually mapped
        isRightHandedReads - whether the reads are right-handed

      • getSingleUnmappedSamRecords

        public void getSingleUnmappedSamRecords(java.io.File bamFile,
                               java.io.File fastqIn,
                               java.io.File fastqOut,
                               boolean isRightHandedReads)
        Returns the fastq sequences that have not been mapped to a genome. All fastq reads must either be left-handed or right-handed
        Parameters:
        bamFile - a sam/bam file
        fastqIn - the fastq dataset that was mapped to the sam/bam file
        fastqOut - the fastq reads that were not mapped
        isRightHandedReads - whether the reads are right-handed

      • getOnePairedMappedSamRecords

        public void getOnePairedMappedSamRecords(java.io.File bamFile,
                                java.io.File fastqInLeft,
                                java.io.File fastqInRight,
                                java.io.File fastqOutLeft,
                                java.io.File fastqOutRight)
        Returns the pairs of sequences where at least one of the pair has been mapped to a genome.
        Parameters:
        bamFile - a sam/bam file
        fastqInLeft - the left-hand fastq dataset that was mapped to the sam/bam file
        fastqInRight - the righ-hand fastq dataset that was mapped to the sam/bam file
        fastqOutLeft - the left-hand fastq reads where one of the pair actually mapped
        fastqOutRight - the right-hand fastq reads where one of the pair actually mapped
